Class Library

java.lang.Object
Library
public class Library extends Object
Class name: Library This class represents a library and its collection of books. It provides methods for loading books from a text file, adding new books to the collection, listing all books in the collection remove books from the database, and backup an old version of the file before doing new changes.

      public ArrayList<Book> getBooks()

    • loadBooksFromDatabase

      public void loadBooksFromDatabase() throws SQLException
      Method name: loadBooksFromDatabase This method loads books from a MySQL database into the library's collection of books.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a database access error occurred

    • addBookToDatabase

      public void addBookToDatabase(String title, String author, String barcode) throws SQLException
      Method name: addBookToDatabase This method adds a new book to the library's collection and saves it to a MySQL database.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a database access error occurred

    • removeBookBarcode

      public String removeBookBarcode(String identifier, boolean isBarcode) throws SQLException
      Method name: removeBookBarcode This method removes a book from the library's collection using its ID or barcode.
      Parameters:
      identifier - The ID or barcode of the book to be removed.
      isBarcode - A boolean flag indicating whether the identifier is a barcode. If true, the identifier is treated as a barcode; if false, it's treated as an ID.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a database access error occurred

    • removeBookByTitle

      public String removeBookByTitle(String title) throws SQLException
      Method name: removeBookByTitle This method removes a book from the library's collection by title, which is supplied by the user.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the book to be removed.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a database access error occurred

    • listBooks

      public String listBooks() throws SQLException
      Method name: listBooks This method lists all books currently in the library's collection.
      Returns:
      A string representation of all books in the collection
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a database access error occurred

    • checkoutBook

      public String checkoutBook(String title) throws SQLException
      Method name: checkoutBook This method checks out a book from the library's collection using its title. If the book is found and is not already checked out, it sets the book as checked out and assigns a due date 4 weeks from now. It then updates the library database.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the book to be checked out.
      Returns:
      boolean Returns true if the book was successfully checked out, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • checkInBook

      public String checkInBook(String title) throws SQLException
      Method name: checkInBook This method checks in a book to the library's collection using its title. If the book is found and is checked out, it sets the book as checked in and removes the due date. If the due date has passed, it informs the user about a fine. It then prints a message indicating that the book was successfully checked in.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the book to be checked in.
      Returns:
      boolean Returns true if the book was successfully checked in, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an input or output exception occurred
      SQLException

    • reorderIds

      public void reorderIds() throws SQLException
      Throws:
      SQLException
